intro: Lutzia lata, commonly known as the broad-leaved lutzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its glossy, broad elliptical leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. The plant produces small, clustered white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Lutzia lata is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, tropical climates. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blossoms.
